intro: Cyclocotyla congolensis, commonly known as the Congo cyclocotyla, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
